direction.raw_text: Well, happy birthday, Aibileen. You should have told me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, from all over the county, my babies find they way home. Aibileen stops on one card in particular. She sits back down next to Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some even from overseas. Alton Spears lives in Paris now. Married him a real pretty French girl. Got five kids, too...they's my grandbabies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Aibileen opens the card to find a twenty dollar bill inside along with a picture of the Spears family. Aibileen reads the card aloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still don't drink coffee. Happy Birthday. Love Alton. Aibileen laughs and raises her hand to her mouth. Skeeter is touched. The doorbell rings. Aibileen jumps up and opens the door. A delivery man greets her with two more vases of flowers. Aibileen looks out to the street where a white woman gets out of her car with a huge country ham. Two little girls in matching dresses jump out behind her. The woman sees Aibileen on the porch and waves. Aibileen waves back and smiles. Catching it all, the moment soon grows bittersweet for Skeeter. She wipes her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning light shines into Skeeter's room. Stuart has returned from the rig. Fully clothed, he and Skeeter sleep on Skeeter's bed. Charlotte shouts Skeeter's name from down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Eugenia?! Skeeter's eyes pop open. She's groggy and hasn't fully realized the company lying next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?! Stuart throws his arm over Skeeter. Reality sinks in. Skeeter rolls over to find Stuart, eyes shut, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God! Oh my God! When Stuart tries to get up, Skeeter flattens him reaches down and pulls the covers up over his entire body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move a muscle! Skeeter props up on her side and faces the door making sure the covers hide that she's clothed. Charlotte enters and heads straight for Skeeter's closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Sleepy Head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Mom. Charlotte pulls out a dress and lays it on the bed, right on top of Stuart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you could take me to the doctor this morning and then we could get some lunch afterwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure! Charlotte spies a LARGE TOE sticking out of the covers. It belongs to Stuart, but she assumes it's Skeeter's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at toe) Or...we could...go straight to Fanny Mae's for a girl day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great! I'll get dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did Stuart leave last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right after you went to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I hope he knows he's welcome to stay in Carlton's old room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not really ready for that yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Bird in the hand," Eugenia. Bird. In. The. Hand... Charlotte exits and shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under the covers.) Chirp. Chirp. Skeeter is mortified. Stuart sits up, grinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God! Stuart tries to kiss Skeeter. She resists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My breath is horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So is mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stuart embraces Skeeter and brings his lips close to hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, too. They kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bank's clock shows twelve noon in downtown Jackson. It's eerily quiet, not a soul on the street... We hear archival footage of Walter Cronkite addressing the nation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny stands at the top of a tall step ladder vacuuming Oscar's head. Celia runs into the living room. Tears stream down her face. Minny turns to Celia. Cronkite tells the nation that John F. Kennedy is dead. Minny's eyes roll back in her head as she starts to faint. She grabs on to Oscar's body and slides down to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly sits with her son William playing on a blanket on the front lawn. A neighbor suddenly pulls up in his car stopping in front of Hilly. He leans out and tells Hilly the tragic news. In complete disbelief, Hilly puts her hand over her mouth. She then grabs William, pulls him in close as if he's somehow in danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen huddles with a dozen other maids in a circle. They're all crying. Some throw their hands in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter and Stuart sit solemnly with the Phelan family watching Cronkite's coverage of the Kennedy funeral. Skeeter's dad wipes tears from his eyes. Stuart checks the time and leans into Skeeter's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, I'm sorry, but I have to get down to the coast. Skeeter nods as Stuart kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back in time for the benefit. Love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, too. We hear Walter Cronkite's parting thoughts on JFK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny, Skeeter and Aibileen sit quietly compiling stories. Aibileen and Minny look up to Aibileen's framed picture of John F. Kennedy. Aibileen grows anxious. She suddenly jumps out of her chair and paces around the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world done gone crazy, Miss Skeeter! And I'm scared! What if folks find out what we writing? Figure out Niceville really Jackson, and figure out who who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen. We've changed all the names. Aibileen snaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all two gone sit there and tell me you one hundred percent without a doubt sure `bout all this?! Skeeter looks away..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...So I been thinking...Maybe we need us some insurance. Skeeter look to Minny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told God I'd never speak of it again. But we got no choice. It's time...Time to tell you both "the terrible awful" I did to Miss Hilly. It might be the only thing to protect us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We continue with the earlier flashback where Minny arrives at Hilly's with her famed chocolate pie. Hilly leads Minny into the kitchen, Missus Walters follows behind. Hilly slices a big piece and grabs a fork. She leans against the counter and takes a big bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody wanted to hire a sass- mouthing, thieving nigra, did they? Minny stands silent as Hilly finishes in three bites.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pie's as good as always, Minny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you like it. Hilly cuts another piece for herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If...I take you back, I'll have to cut your pay five dollars a week. Not expecting this, Minny leans away from Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take me back? Hilly takes an even bigger bite from the second slice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you put in here that makes it taste so good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That good vanilla from Mexico... Minny's eyes narrow over a forced smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And...something else real special. Missus Walters grabs a plate and reaches for the pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Missus Walters. That Miss Hilly's special pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Momma can have a piece. Hilly slides the pie a little too fast down the counter toward Minny. Minny stops it before it falls to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut her one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat my shit. Hilly calmly sets her plate down on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said eat my shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you lost your mind?! Minny moves toward Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But you're about to, `cause you just did. Minny nods smugly as she looks down at Hilly's slice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did what? Missus Walters immediately gets it. She bursts out laughing so hard she has to lower herself to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Hilly, that's what you get, I guess. And you didn't just eat one. You ate two slices! Hilly starts to hyperventilate as everything sinks in. As Minny leaves, Hilly runs to the sink and throws up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen and Skeeter are speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You trying to get yourself killed?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I never planned to tell her! I just wanted to see her take a bite and leave so I could be done with her. Forever! She was never supposed to ask me back. Minny eyes narrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, then for less pay! That got me even madder. And, then she went slid that pie at me. Oh lord! That was it! I just lost control, Aibileen...you know how I get, now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, before I knew it, it just came on out my mouth...and I had tolt her what was in that pie. Aibileen looks to Skeeter shaking her head. Minny suddenly gets misty. She wipes her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've asked God to forgive me. But, more for what happened to poor Missus Walters. Miss Hilly threw her in that nursing home just for laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't put that story in the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too dangerous, Minny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need insurance! Hilly Holbrook can't never let people know that pie story is about her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly! If people find out "The Terrible Awful" was you and Miss Hilly, then we in trouble. Trouble there ain't words for!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right! But don't you see? Miss Hilly gone go to her grave convincing people this book ain't about Jackson. Then we safe, insured! Minny gets up and walks toward Aibileen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brought me into this, and I'm on finish it! Either put it in or pull my parts out all together. Minny storms out of Aibileen's kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Stein talks to Skeeter on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last editor's meeting is December 17th. If you want a chance of this getting read, I need it in my hands by then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's in a week, Miss Stein!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otherwise it goes in The Pile. You don't want it in The Pile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you must get a piece in about the domestic who raised you. It'll add something personal to it. Skeeter nods with frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - BALLROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT The African Children's Benefit Ball is well underway. The energy and look of the two hundred attendees feel like a throwback to the women's suffrage movement. Many older women wear heavy long black skirts and jackets. Hilly wears swathes of maroon-colored taffeta. Ruffles clutch her throat. She stands next to Jolene French and a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dressed to the nines, Jolene raises a microphone and looks into the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Jolene French reporting from the African Children's Benefit Ball, and I'm here with League President Miss Hilly Holbrook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Jolene... Three dozen servers stand in a line. Minny and Aibileen are among them. Tables are covered with items donated for the auction. On the baked goods table, Minny's famed chocolate pie promises to again be a big money maker. Celia and Johnny enter the ballroom. Celia wears a hideous, pink and silver sequined gown. As usual, Celia's breasts command attention. The room locks on Celia as specks of light bounce off her dress and jiggle across the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tips his martini onto his wife's shoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a little too loudly) Look at the jugs on that one!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Other wives dig fingernails into husbands' arms. The man's wife responds louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bosoms are for bedrooms and breast- feeding. Not occasions of dignity. Celia downs a glass of champagne and leans into Johnny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think I might have overdressed a little? It's supposed to be formal, but this looks like a funeral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look gorgeous. Minny pulls Aibileen aside and points to Celia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look what she got on. Celia grabs more champagne from a passing server.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord have mercy. Ladies better hold onto they husbands tonight. Celia catches eyes with Minny. She smiles and nods quickly and then looks away, careful not to tip off Johnny of their relationship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's the man that don't even know he's paying me. Skeeter enters with Stuart. She wears a long-sleeved black velvet dress and her hair is being somewhat cooperative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's Skeeter and that must be Stuart. He's handsome... Missus Walters?! Missus Walters enters wearing a floor-length blue beaded gown, circa 1943. A white orchid wilts at her clavicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly can throw her in a home, but she can't keep the taxis away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - BALLROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Celia approaches Elizabeth and Jolene who talk next to a punch bowl. Celia is now drinking some kind of pink drink with an umbrella sticking out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hello, Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Elizabeth's homemade maternity ball gown resembles a velvet potato sack cinched with red ribbon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are lovely dresses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yours too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?! I was worried I was a tad overdressed. Jolene reaches out an pats Celia's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. You're just perfect. Elizabeth pulls Jolene away. Celia downs her drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - BALLROOM - LATER THAT EVENING The guests are now seated at twenty-eight round tables. Scores of black servers dressed in tuxedos ferry plates. Hilly makes her way to the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody enjoying their dinner? The room claps enthusiastically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's give a nice round of applause for all the men and women that have helped make tonight possible. Hilly mechanically gestures toward the servers in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cause I'm sure is dear to their hearts as well. Skeeter shakes her head as the less inspired applause dies down. Celia waves to Minny and jumps out of her chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woo-hoo! Johnny grabs Celia by the arm and pulls her back down. Celia reaches for Johnny's glass of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, maybe you've had enough to drink. Try to eat your dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And have my stomach poke out?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - LATER THAT EVENING As Celia looks at the prize table's bids, Johnny and Stuart lean against a bar chatting with a few other bored men. Hilly suddenly slides next to Johnny completely ignoring Stuart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, Johnny Foote. I'm surprised to see you here. Everybody knows you can't stand parties like this. Hilly squeezes the crook of his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia wouldn't have missed this for anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is that wife of yours? Out selling hotdogs? Johnny looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you know I'm teasing you. We dated long enough where I can do that, can't I? Johnny walks away leaving Hilly no choice but to acknowledge Stuart. She and Stuart never look each other's way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly. Hilly walks away as Jolene approaches the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got the list of winners!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - BALLROOM - MOMENTS LATER Jolene finishes up the winners list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you enjoy your new set of tires, Missus Atwell. Now, on to the baked goods. Jolene flips a page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yum! Yum! The highest bid in baked goods goes to Minny Jackson's chocolate pie. Congratulations, Hilly Holbrook! The room erupts in applause. Hilly now sits at a table with her family, Missus Walters, and the Leefolts. Skeeter and Stuart sit at a table full of elderly people they don't know. Minny clears dishes nearby. Hearing her name, she becomes very alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? I didn't bid on anything. Minny turns to find Hilly smiling at her tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, wasn't that sweet. Someone signed me up for that pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. Celia rushes up behind Hilly, her voice slurred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations, Hilly! I didn't know you're a fan of Minny's pies. Hilly remains calm. Celia grabs Hilly's long sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've wanted to talk to you all night. Minny told me why you won't be my friend. You think me and Johnny went behind your back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me go! Hilly stands up and pulls away. A ripping sound cuts through the air. Celia stares at Hilly's torn cuff in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you trying to do to me? What are you and that nigra up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jolene announces another round of winners loudly over the microphone, forcing Celia to raise her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -You liar! Who did you tell?! Jolene loses her place on the list. The room grows quiet but Celia is still yelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly, I got pregnant after you and Johnny broke up! The room echoes with Celia's words. Across the room, women's noses wrinkle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Mother. Stuart belts out with a laugh. Skeeter pinches his arm. Celia is mortified. Sweat beads on her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny never cheated on you...At least, not with me. Celia starts to breathe heavily. Her eyes start to water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny would never-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm sorry I thought you'd be tickled to win that pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell that nigra if she tells anybody, I will make her suffer. Horrified, Skeeter catches eyes with Minny and Aibileen. They all immediately look away. Johnny makes his way over. Celia holds her breath, shaking her head back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia, what's wrong, Honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh. Celia leans over and vomits on the fleur-de-lis print carpet. The entire room gasps in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit! Johnny tries to pull Celia back. She pushes Johnny away and runs for the bathroom. He follows. Hilly marches over to Aibileen who is standing nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that cleaned up before it starts to smell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - KITCHEN - LATER THAT NIGHT Minny's daughter, Sugar, stands over a large commercial sink filled with sudsy water, washing dishes. Minny approaches from behind as Sugar holds court with five other young girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That big-boobed lady Momma works for was drunker than an Injun on payday. Upchucked in front a everbody! As the girls all laugh, Minny pops Sugar hard on the back of her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you never let me hear you talking bad about the lady who puts food in your mouth. Clothes on your back! You hear me? Minny storms off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do it all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEE HOTEL - PARKING LOT - LATER THAT NIGHT Hilly and William walk to their car. Missus Walters follows closely behind, holding Minny's pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just come on home and stay with us tonight, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks, I got a pie to eat. Hilly spins around and sees the pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You throw that pie away right now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spent good money on this. Won it just for you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You?! You signed me up? Missus Walters steps up to Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I may have trouble remembering my own name and what country I live in. But there's two things I can't seem to forget. That my own daughter threw me in a nursing home...And that she ate Minny's shit. Missus Walters winks at Hilly and ambles to a waiting taxi cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia lies in bed with the covers pulled over her face. Minny enters carrying a tray of food, setting it down next to two other trays of uneaten food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't Mister Johnny gone wonder how dinner got on the table if you laid up in bed? Celia pulls the covers off her head and sits up a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The way Hilly looked at me. Like I was trash on the road. Celia pulls a letter out from under the covers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She billed me for her dress. In lieu of payment, she's asked that I send two-hundred dollars to the African Children's Fund and then she banned me from all future League events.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She don't count. Don't judge yourself by the way she see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not right for this kind of life, Minny. I don't need a dinner table for twelve people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't get two people over here if I begged. She called me a liar and accused me of getting her that pie. I wouldn't have thrown up if it wasn't for that! I can't do this anymore to Johnny. I'm going back to Sugar Ditch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gone leave your husband cause you threw up at some party? Celia sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, I reckon it's time you knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia stares at Minny, wide-eyed and disgusted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Hilly thought you knew `bout "The Terrible Awful," that you were making fun a her. It's my fault she pounced on you. But if you leave Mister Johnny, then Miss Hilly done won the whole ball game. Then she done beat me, and she done beat you. Celia lies there. Minny's concerned she's said too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. For telling me that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart lies on a bed inside the Presidential Suite of the Roosevelt Hotel. He's on the phone with Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter talks to Stuart. Pascagoula cooks breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart! How are you calling me? Aren't you on the rig?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I told you I have twenty- four hours in New Orleans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That I'm in the Presidential Suite of the Roosevelt Hotel...That we have dinner reservations in the Blue Room tonight and lunch tomorrow at Galatoires. Skeeter becomes troubled...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear me? I spoke to your dad, and he's gonna have Jameso drive you down right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Stuart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work in the car. Jesus, Skeeter, it's a cleaning column.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a deadline, Sweetie. You should have asked me about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to be romantic...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Honey. I can't come. Stuart shakes his head and hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FAYE BELLE'S HOME - LATER THAT NIGHT Aibileen and Skeeter sit across from, FAYE BELLE, 101, palsied and gray skinned and hunched in a wheelchair. Aibileen grabs Faye Belle's hand stirring a sudden flash of memory. Her voice is coarse and hard to understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember hiding with Miss Lilia in a steamer trunk while Yankee soldiers stomped through Master's house. We were both four. Eighty- five years later she died in my arms. We's were friends `til the end. Her grandson still pays my rent. Buys all my groceries too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The manuscript sits before Aibileen, Minny and Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have one more story to type, but other than that, we are done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Law, look at all them pages. Two- hundred and sixty-six of `em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we just wait and see? Hopin' Missus Stein publish it? Skeeter nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What story you got left to type?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mine. Aibileen looks at Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If your momma won't tell you, I reckon I will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red-eyed, Skeeter enters Charlotte's room. A bowl rests on the bedside table with a wet rag draped over the side. Charlotte is wig free and terribly thin. Her collarbone protrudes long and narrow, but her eyes are as sharp as ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been crying? You know that ages your skin, Dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother, I need to talk to you about Constantine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Eugenia. That was so long ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I have to speak to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, you look. I was good to Constantine. Oh, she talked back plenty of times, and I put up with it. But, Skeeter, she didn't give me a choice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What...happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte, much healthier, scurries around the house adjusting flower arrangements and straightening pictures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I was hosting a D.A.R. luncheon. Constantine was to do the floors that morning so they'd be dry in time. Charlotte finds Constantine mopping the foyer very slowly. The effects of arthritis are apparent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Well, the floors were soaking wet when the first guest arrived. A guest unnecessarily grabs a table for balance, making a point about the damp floor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte sits with twelve women at the dining table as Constantine pushes the casserole cart around and begins serving lunch. As the guests sip coffee, each woman grimaces and turns to Charlotte.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Then, she burned the coffee. She had gotten so old, Skeeter. Charlotte shoots Constantine a look. Constantine nods sorrowfully. She picks up a woman's plate and begins filling it with food from the cart very slowly. Constantine strains to lower the plate in front of the woman. Her hands tremble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Her mishaps were becoming a daily occurrence, and I had had it. The plate tilts causing peas to pour into the woman's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch out! With that, Charlotte stands up and slaps the table with her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a hold of yourself, Constantine! Constantine slowly looks to Charlotte. Totally exhausted, she grips the casserole cart with both hands to steady herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) And that's when it happened. Constantine wets herself. Slowly the women begin realizing what's happening. The two women closest to Constantine gasp and quickly move away from her. Another woman rises from the table covering her mouth with a napkin and leaves the room. Just now realizing what has happened, Constantine looks down at her soiled dress. No one says a word. No one comes to Constantine's aid. Constantine looks to Charlotte.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Constantine hobbles with a cane down a gravel road still wearing her soiled dress. She turns and looks one last time at the Phelan Plantation...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told her she couldn't work here anymore and to go on home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter trembles. Charlotte won't look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you humiliate her like that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you help her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was upset. I didn't know what else to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you just threw her away? That woman did you the biggest favor of your life. She taught me kindness and self respect and you just threw her away like a broken appliance. Charlotte starts to cry. Skeeter isn't affected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't throw her away, Skeeter. Your daddy went to her house the very next day to give her her job back. But she had already moved to Chicago. Left everything behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `Cause she didn't have anything anymore. You broke her heart!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't do this to me, Skeeter. I feel terrible. And you have to remember, they're not like us. They are different. Charlotte gets defensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you idolized her too much! You always have!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I needed somebody to look up to. Skeeter turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go find her. She needs me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We finally found the address of her daughter in Chicago...so we sent Carlton up there to go get Constantine. Skeeter turns back to her mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he got there...she was dead, Eugenia. I'm so sorry, Honey. Charlotte tries to comfort her. Skeeter rejects her mother's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't y'all tell me all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew you'd blame me...when it wasn't my fault. It just happened, and it was so unfortunate. I'm sorry, Eugenia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did she die? How long had she been in Chicago?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Charlotte pulls the white basin closer, hugs it to her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two weeks. Skeeter stands, never turning as she exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter stands on the back patio crying. She slowly walks off into the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Constantine's story finally made it in our book. But the reason she got fired did not. Miss Skeeter just couldn't put that kind a shame on her own mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front window of a bookstore displays many of the nation's top selling books. A clerk sets a tiny stack of books in the far corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) They printed a few thousand copies with the worst advance Miss Stein had ever seen. The stack is "The Help," in hardcover. It's wrapped in pale blue. A white peace dove spreads its wing under the title.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MINNY'S HOME - LIVING ROOM - DAY Minny stands over the stove frying chicken as Sugar enters with the day's mail. Minny snatches the mail from her and sees an envelope from Harper and Row. Minny tears it open. Her eyes go wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We got four hundred dollars. Got another four hundred when it got printed. Divided thirteen ways that came to sixty-one fifty-three a person. Minny hugs Sugar and runs out the screen door with her check as the chicken sizzles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIBILEEN'S HOME - KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER Aibileen and Minny hug each other as the jump up and down with checks in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Minny got so excited she burnt up a skillet of chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny knocks on the door holding bags of groceries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Miss Celia! Get out a that bed and let me in. It's twelve noon. I did all the shopping just like you asked. The door slowly opens. Celia steps out onto the porch, looking beautiful, still dressed tacky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, look at you, Miss Celia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia leads Minny into the dining room. The table, set beautifully in silver and crystal, is covered with delicious looking casseroles and fried chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cooked it all by myself. I wanted to do something special. I wanted to say "thank you."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia and Minny dine, and Minny's enjoying it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greens got just the right amount a hock taste to `em. That's a good pot liquor, Miss Celia. Who taught you to cook like this? Minny winks as she dunks a piece of corn bread in the greens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corn bread's happy now. Celia lays down her fork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you happy, Minny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you ask such a funny question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A course I's happy. You happy too. Big house, big yard, good husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, if I were you, I'd give it right back to him. I'd hit him over the head with a skillet and tell him to go straight to hell... Minny starts to protest but is tired of excuses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I will. Celia jumps up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I almost forgot the dessert. Minny smiles softly as Celia disappears into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEEFOLT HOME - LIVING ROOM - LATER THAT DAY Aibileen irons as Elizabeth enters with shopping bags. She races to the television and turns it on. As the tube warms up, we hear the conclusion of a Tide commercial. WLBT's lunchtime show, "People Will Talk," continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jolene French sits on the set of Jackson's morning show. A MALE HOST watches as the show runner counts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five, four, three, two, one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome back to "People Will Talk." And do we have something to talk about. Jolene has quite a book to review. Jolene shakes her head, visibly upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly watches Jolene on television as her new maid,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pours a cup of coffee with her right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ernestine's left arm is missing. The maid pickings for Hilly have gotten slim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you frowning, Jolene? Hilly leans over and taps her television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't look cute that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's called "The Help." A new book by an anonymous author. Aibileen jerks her head toward the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touching and enlightening, it's filled with testimonials from Mississippi's own housekeepers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny watches transfixed as she and Celia eat dessert in front of the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look how cute that dress is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Takes place in the fictional town of "Niceville." The book is dedicated to C and T. If you're out there C and T, we'd love to have you on the show because Niceville sounds like Jackson, if you ask me. The host starts laughing. Jolene snaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not Jackson! It's a disgrace to the South! A disgrace to good Southern women who've spent their lives taking care of their help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke rises from the shirt Aibileen is ironing. She snaps to attention, pulls the iron off the burned shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But did you read that ending?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I personally treat my help like family, and every one of my friends does the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bertha, if you're listening, I have a new found respect for what you do. And, believe me, I'll be passin' on dessert at your table!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny walks like a zombie over to Celia and gathers her dirty plate, never taking her eyes off the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not buy this book! Ladies of Jackson, do not support slander with your husband's hard earned- Poof! Jolene disappears by way of a Seal-Lily ice cream commercial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't cut her off like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that book called, Aibileen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I wasn't paying attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacks of "The Help" rest on tables in the store. Elizabeth enters, pick up two copies and pulls them close to her body. She races to the register like a teen buying a Playboy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back at the table of books, we see in rapid succession the books quickly disappearing by the hands of Jacksonians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AIBILEEN'S HOME - KITCHEN - THAT NIGHT Aibileen, Skeeter and Minny sit at the table. Aibileen's phone rings off the wall, but she won't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew nothing about it. Miss Stein's P.R. Department called the station directly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever maid callin' to say they white lady's gone and bought the book. They so scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `One-arm-Earnestine' said Miss Leefolt brought a copy over to Miss Hilly in less than a hour. She better read it quick and start the "this ain't Jackson crusade."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't count on it. In her one year at Ole Miss she never cracked a book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, she gone read it. Especially after that man made such a stink on the tee-vee. She gone read it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEEFOLT HOME/HOLBROOK HOME (INTERCUT) - DAY Elizabeth and Hilly read the book aloud over the phone with each other. They stop and nod with speculation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bus is filled with domestics en route to work. Everyone is either reading the book or having it read to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NURSING HOME - NIGHT Missus Walters reads to a group of women in the home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte lies in bed reading the book next to Robert, who is asleep. As she turns a page, her face reveals a dawning realization. Troubled, she starts to wake Robert but doesn't. Charlotte trembles as she brings the book in close to her chest. She slides down to her pillow and stares at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter sits on the swing with Stuart who's just arrived from the rig, still wearing his dingy work clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That month felt like a year. I missed you so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter, I told Daddy I'm not going back on the rig. Stuart nonchalantly pulls out a ring from his front pocket and places it in Skeeter's lap. A huge diamond is surrounded by twelve small sapphires. Skeeter's smile quickly fades as she raises the ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart...I have to tell you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about "yes?!" I had this with me down in New Orleans, you know. Skeeter touches Stuart's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious...and...you have to promise not to tell anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on. Did you say `yes'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Stuart hugs Skeeter. She pulls back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But listen. Can I have your word? Skeeter has again ruined Stuart's big moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. You have my word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart storms off the porch, dumbfounded. Finally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what you've been writing for the last twelve months?! What happened to the cleaning column?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Skeeter approaches Stuart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, the talk in town? I said they were dead wrong. Told them you were too smart to get mixed up in anything like that. Skeeter reaches to calm him. He pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That joke you played on Hilly with the toilets. Hell, that's funny. But this? I don't understand why you did this...why you even care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things are fine around here. Why stir up trouble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not stirring up trouble, Stuart. Trouble's already here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess it is. Skeeter grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to tell you. You needed to know. Stuart shakes his head and pulls away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I don't really know you, Skeeter. And I can't marry somebody I don't know. Stuart looks down at the ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was my grandmother's. Skeeter hands the ring back. Stuart shoves it in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. I won't tell anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte sits in bed next to Robert who is fast asleep. She hears a door closing outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter?! Come in here, please. After a few moments, Skeeter enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Can I get you anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here, Eugenia. I want to tell you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart proposed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. He had to ask Daddy for your hand. She lifts Skeeter's ring hand. Seeing her bare finger, Charlotte's smile fades. Skeeter prepares for the worst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing! Skeeter stands to walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young lady, I'm talking to you! Skeeter sits back down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart'll come around. It's a funny dance. (points to Robert ) Took this one a year. Anyway, my news. After a long talk with your daddy, I've made a decision. My health's been on the uptick these past few weeks. And I know the doctor says it's some kind of last
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Charlotte starts coughing. Skeeter hands her a tissue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, as I said, I made a decision. I have decided not to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Momma. Charlotte slaps her palms as if throwing the cancer away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. I tried calling Fanny Mae's so I could make your hair appointments for the next twenty years, but they wouldn't allow it. Charlotte raises Skeeter's ring finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I certainly can't leave you now. Skeeter laughs and hugs her mother. Robert never stirs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly drives in front of Jitney Jingle grocery store. She wears a scarf on her head and big sunglasses. One-armed Ernestine rides in the passenger seat. Hilly slows in front of the store's big glass entrance. She hurriedly waves Ernestine out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The voters of Hinds County had spoke. Mister Holbrook wasn't gone have no political career. One-Arm Ernestine races to the storefront and removes William's campaign poster taped to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly reads the book in bed. William is fast asleep. Suddenly, her eyes widen, her breath becomes heavy. She slowly turns a page and freezes. Her face turns white. Hilly balls both fists, looks to the ceiling and screams louder than humanly possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter lies in bed sleeping. Her eyes pop open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen lies in bed sleeping. Her eyes pop open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny lies in bed sleeping. Her eyes pop open. But, this time, Hilly's scream fades as knocks at the door grow louder. Knocking that has actually stirred Minny awake. Sugar and Kindra enter, jumping in bed with Minny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Momma, there's a white man at our door!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Minny Jackson! Are you in there?! Minny covers the girls with a blanket. She puts on a robe and grabs a bat from behind the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) (CONT'D) I can hear you. Open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny approaches the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny Foote. Minny Jackson, I want to talk to you. Open up. Minny slowly opens the door. Johnny is all smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally, I meet Minny Jackson... As Johnny enters, Minny raises the bat and swings. Johnny turns and stops the bat with his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doin'?! Minny lets go of the bat and cowers on the floor, raises her hands in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't hurt me! My babies are in the house. Johnny drops the bat and pulls Minny up from the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down, girl. I'm not here to get you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He suddenly throws his arms around her and squeezes hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny and Minny sit at her kitchen table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I finally confronted Celia about you, she told me about the baby. All of them. You saved her life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I know the day you came to our house, she started getting better. And I'm not just talking about the cookin' either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew I was there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fried chicken and okra on the first night? Y'all should have at least put corn pone on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't make you eat anymore corn pone, Mister Johnny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next morning, I snuck back up to the house, peeked in the window, and there you were. Given ol' Oscar a wipe down. Minny smiles for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I ain't losing my job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a job with us for the rest of your life, if you want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEEFOLT HOME - LIVING ROOM - DAY Bridge is underway at the Leefolt house with the usual suspects, except Skeeter. LOU ANN TEMPLETON has taken her place. Aibileen nervously pours coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard that Betty character might be Charlene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not Jackson, and that book is garbage. I bet the whole thing's made up by some nigra. Aibileen begins pouring coffee into Hilly's cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, Jolene, didn't your momma leave Cora to you in her will?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes...But that's not odd is it? Happens all the time, right? A sudden realization washes over Jolene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did anybody ever figured out who C and T are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The book is NOT ABOUT JACKSON! Aibileen spills a few drops of coffee on Hilly's plate. Hilly looks up to Aibileen slow and deliberate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spilled some, Aibileen. Aibileen takes the cloth from the coffee pitcher handle and dabs the spilled coffee. Aibileen glances at Hilly. A secret burns between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me a new plate. One you haven't soiled with a dirty cloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen and Minny walk into the church parking lot wearing their Sunday best. Minny takes note of all the cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We late? Looks like Bible study done already started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We ain't late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Minny and Aibileen enter the church. Four-hundred members stand at once. The congregation begins to clap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Minny and Aibileen look around trying to figure out the source of adulation. They both start clapping too. Aibileen steps up to a woman in the last pew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who we clappin' for? The woman laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, we clappin' for you. The woman raises a copy of "The Help." Aibileen notices a copy of the book in each member's hand. Aibileen looks to Minny, realizing she's in on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches, hands Aibileen a copy of the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen, this is an important time for you and our church. We know you couldn't put your name in here, so we all signed our own. The Reverend then hands her a box wrapped in white paper, tied with a blue ribbon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for the white lady. Tell her we love her like family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter sits between Aibileen and Minny on the sofa thumbing through her signed book. Hundreds of signatures cover the pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Churches over two counties signed our books. All for you and me. Aibileen points to the inside back cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor King signed it, too. He readin' our book. Aibileen glances proudly at the framed portrait of Dr. King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did something. We did something good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful. Skeeter closes the book and sets it down regretfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? Skeeter pulls a letter out of her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a job offer from Harper and Row...in New York.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That real good, Miss Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I not taking it. I just wanted to share it with you both. There's no one else I can tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you mean you not takin' it? This is what you been dreaming of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't leave you two right when things are getting bad from a mess I created. I set out to write a book to make white people thankful. But in the end, what we should say is "sorry."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If bad things happen, they ain't nothing you can do about it. And if they happen, at least now theys a reason behind it. A reason we can wrap our heads around and be proud of... Skeeter nods with little relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, I don't mean to rub salt in your wound, but...you ain't got a good life here in Jackson. Plus, your momma's getting better- Minny aggressively chimes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't got nothing left here but enemies in the Junior League. You done burned ever bridge there is. And you ain't never gone get another man in this town, and ever body know it. So don't walk your white butt to New York, RUN IT! Minny leans over, placing her hand on Skeeter's for the first time since knowing each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you listen to me. I'm on take care a Aibileen, and she gone take care a me. Skeeter nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go find your life, Miss Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skeeter stands next to the barn smoking a cigarette reading the Harper and Row offer for the hundredth time. Tires crunch gravel down the drive. Skeeter sees a car moving toward her with the headlights off. Worried, Skeeter looks toward her home. Charlotte can be seen in an upstairs window. Skeeter soon recognizes the car as Hilly's. Hilly parks, lights a cigarette and gets out of her car. Skeeter charges toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here? Hilly screams and throws her lit cigarette at Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you get an inch closer! Hilly's a mess. Her shirt is half tucked. Her shorts strain to contain a newly developed layer of fat. A horrible fever blister burns hot on Hilly's upper lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've contacted my lawyer, Hibbie Goodman. He's the best libel attorney in Mississippi. You're in big trouble, Missy. And you're going to jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't prove anything, Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I one-hundred-percent know you wrote it `cause nobody else in town is as tacky as you. Those nigras of yours are in a lifetime of trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly who are you talking about? You don't know anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't, do I? You tell Aibileen, the next time she wants to write about my dear friend Elizabeth...uh- huh. Remember her? Had you in her wedding? Let's just say, Aibileen ought to've been a little bit smarter before putting in the L- shaped crack in poor Elizabeth's dining table. And that nigra, Minny? Do I have plans for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, Hilly. Don't give yourself away now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was not me WHO ATE THAT PIE! Hilly storms up the porch steps. Skeeter follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did not invite you here! Skeeter yanks Hilly's arm hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come to tell your mother what a hippie you've become. She's gonna be disgusted by you. Skeeter can't help but laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're telling my mother on me? Hilly opens the door. Skeeter grabs her. They struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get out of here! Charlotte suddenly appears. Skeeter lets go of Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, Hilly...It's been such a long time, Dear. Everything okay, you two? Hilly is shocked by Charlotte's frail appearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Missus Phelan, I'm...I'm here to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly, you're a mess. Are you ill? Hilly self-consciously licks her fever blister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I...I didn't have time to get fixed up before-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darling, no husband wants to come home and see this. Charlotte peers closely at Hilly's cold sore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that...that is horrendous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Missus Phelan, I'm here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Hilly. If I didn't know any better, I'd say you've been eating too many...SWEETS? Hilly's face turns purple with embarrassment. Charlotte moves in for the kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In fact. I'm sure of it. Now GET OUT OF MY HOUSE...before we all get one of those on our lip. Hilly looks back and forth between Skeeter and her mother, not knowing what to say. Hilly runs out of the house as Charlotte sashays quietly into the living room. Shocked, Skeeter stands alone in the foyer. Hilly sprays gravel across the Phelan yard as she speeds away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) (CONT'D) Eugenia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Come in here, please. Skeeter gulps as she heads toward the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte pats the sofa as Skeeter enters and sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have plans tomorrow? Bible study? Anything like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. We're going shopping. Skeeter lets out a big sigh of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `Cause no single daughter of mine is going to New York, representing the great state of Mississippi, without a proper cosmopolitan wardrobe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm very proud of you, Eugenia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know about New York?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend of Constantine's told me. Charlotte reaches down and pulls up her copy of "The Help".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you do me the honor of signing my copy? Skeeter nods. Charlotte hands Skeeter a pen. Her hand trembles as she signs the book, never having guessed how good it would feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEEFOLT HOME - KITCHEN - MORNING Aibileen washes dishes as the phone begins to ring. She answers. Minny screams on the other end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny stands barefoot inside a phone booth, her lip swollen, face bleeding. Her kids stand outside, crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They fired Leroy last night! And when Leroy ask why, his boss say Mister Holbrook told him to do it. Said his nigger wife the reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Law!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He try to kill me with he bare hands! He threw the kids in the yard, lock me in the bathroom, and say he gone set the house on fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you now?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gas station. I climbed out the window, and we all ran here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on come there now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, Aibileen...I'm pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny, now, you listen to me. That baby gone be fine, and you ain't never gone lose your job. Mister Johnny told you that hisself. They's more book money coming. Your baby ain't gone know about gettin' beat. You hear me? You free, Minny! You are free. Minny lets out a chuckle of relief and wipes her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear you... The Leefolt front door opens. Elizabeth calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Aibileen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEEFOLT HOME - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Aibileen enters to find Elizabeth and Hilly staring at her. Elizabeth is two weeks WAY PAST DUE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning. Hilly licks her cold sore as she steps forward. She glides her hand across the L-shaped crack in the Elizabeth's table, drawing Aibileen's attention to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibileen, the silver I lent Elizabeth last week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It not polished good? Humidity been fighting me on polishing day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you returned it, three pieces were missing out of the felt wrapper. A fork and two spoons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme...lemme go look in the kitchen, maybe I left some behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know as well as I do that silver's not in the kitchen. Aibileen turns to Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You check in Mae Mobley's bed? She been putting things-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you hear her, Elizabeth? She's trying to blame it on a toddler. Elizabeth won't look at Aibileen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't stole no silver. Elizabeth whispers to Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She says she doesn't have them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it behooves me to inform you that you are fired, Aibileen. And I'll be calling the police. They know me. Mae Mobley enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibee, my froat hurts. Mae Mobley coughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I go get her some syrup, Miss Leefolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth can take care of her child. Elizabeth looks to Hilly, appearing somewhat upset with this suggestion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go get the couch syrup. Hilly glares at Aibileen as Elizabeth runs down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't tolerate liars! Mae Mobley becomes scared and hides behind Aibileen's leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't steal no silver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not talking about silver. I'm talking about those things you wrote about Elizabeth. Maybe I can't send you to jail for what you wrote, but I can send you to jail for being a thief. And your friend, Minny? That nigra's got a nice surprise coming to her. Johnny Foote listens to what I say. She's as good as- Aibileen shouts, interrupting Hilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woman!...I know something about you. Don't you forget that. Hilly narrows her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From what Yule May says, they's a lot a time to write letters from jail. Plenty a time to write ever person in Jackson the truth about you, and the paper is free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody would believe something you wrote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Already sold a lot a books. Fear floods into Hilly's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go, Aibiee! Aibileen kneels down as Elizabeth returns with the syrup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby, you need to get back to bed. You got a fever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noooo! Don't go, Aibee. Please don't leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gots to, Baby. I am so sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Are you going to take care of another little girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Baby, that's not the reason. I don't want to leave you, but...It's time for me to retire. You my last little girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noooo!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby Girl, I need you to remember ever thing I told you. Okay? Do you remember what I told you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To wipe my bottom good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Baby. The other. What you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You is kind. You is smart. You is important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Baby Girl. Aibileen squeezes Mae Mobley for the last time. They both cry together. Hilly speaks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to go now, Aibileen! Aibileen rises up from Mae Mobley and turns to Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give my sweet girl a chance. Elizabeth avoids eye contact. Aibileen turns and walks away. As Elizabeth leans down to pick up Mae Mobley....HER WATER BREAKS. She glares at Hilly with shock and regret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEEFOLT HOME - MOMENTS LATER Aibileen steps out of the house with her purse. She walks stoically down the driveway. Tears stream down her face. Mae Mobley runs to the living room window crying. She beats on the glass from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aibeeeee! Don't go! Aibileen never turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Mae Mobley was my last baby. In just thirty minutes, I felt like my whole life was done. Of the thirteen maids, seven of us got fired. Several other maids got fired who had nothin' to do with our book. Guess our stories weren't so unique after all...But, like Minny, we was all free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilly, even fatter now, sifts through the day's mail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And we's was a lot freer than Hilly Holbrook. She comes across a piece from Celia Foote addressed to The Starving Children of Africa Fund. A smug smile forms. She opens the envelope to find a check for $200.00 made out to: TWO-SLICE HILLY! Hilly screams as she rips the check into pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minny folds laundry on a picnic table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Ever so often, we all get a nice piece of book money in the mail. `Manna from heaven' we like to call it. Minny looks across the table and smiles at Celia who is holding and playing with Minny's newborn child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on tombstone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Born December 24th 1883 Died March 15th, 1963 A bouquet of flowers lay at the foot of the tombstone. A copy of "The Help" leans against it. In the distance, a cab slowly pulls away with Skeeter inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIBILEEN'S HOME - KITCHEN - DAY Aibileen sits at her kitchen table, typing on Skeeter's old typewriter. We watch as keys write out the rest of Aibileen's voice over.
direction.name: direction
